fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34569].
  {panel}

Currently, requests for access are sent to just one person:

bq. Confluence will send an email to the a user who can grant permissions - this will be either the last user (with appropriate permissions) to edit the page, the page creator or a space admin. 

If that one person is not available (i.e. on leave) then the request won't get actioned until he/she is back. The person who made the request has no way of knowing if their request has been reviewed. For example, the e-mail to the person who can grant access is generated from a system e-mail address and the out of office auto-reply from the approver would get sent to this email instead of to the person making the request.

A potential solution is allowing Space admins to elect for requests be sent to all space administrators, or allowing the system administrators to decide whether to send request access e-mails to all space administrators instead of the current logic would resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Allow request for access recipients to be chosen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34557].
  {panel}

I'm getting more and more Confluence collaborators using labels, and they complain that tagging keywords as labels doesn't give them any more weight in Search results than any occurrence of the same keyword anywhere in 

Previous versions of Confluence's search interface used to:
* suggest labels when they would be similar to the keyword entered in the search field (then clicking on the label name would display a list of all pages bearing the label)
* indicate when resulting occurrences were actually found among labels (rather than anywhere in the page)

I would like that behavior to be restored. Labels are KEY-words, not just any word typed into page contents.
fields.summary: Restore Labels precedence in Search results

fields.description:
Page with title that contains : (colon) symbol does not allow Office Documents and PDF Macro to be attached.

When your page title contains : (colon) symbol and you try to insert Office Documents and PDF Macro through _Other Macro_ > _Media_ > OfficeDocs/PDF, the _File Name *_ does not show any attachments.

h3. Step To Reproduce
# Create a page with title "TEST : TEST"
# Upload Office document or PDF attachment
# Insert Office document or PDF macro through _Other Macro_ > _Media_ > OfficeDocs/PDF


h3. Expected Result
# It should show the uploaded attachment under _File Name *_ field

h3. Observed Result
# It does not show any uploaded attachment under _File Name *_ field

h3. Workaround
# Remove the : (colon) symbol from the page title temporarily and insert the Office document or PDF macro. Reinsert the : (colon) symbol before saving the page.
fields.summary: Unable to insert Office Documents and PDF Macro with page title contains :

fields.description:
When using a Heading 6 after using the Table of Contents Macro, the position moves based on the next Heading. Reported for version 5.4.4 but I replicated in 5.4.4 and 5.5.4.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Create a new page
# Insert Table of Contents macro
# Type a line, make it Heading 1
# Type a second line, make it Heading 6
# Type a third line, make it Heading 1 and save
# Edit the document, make the third line Heading 2 and save
# Continue changing the heading type for the third line

h3. Expected behavior
The position of the second line should stay the same, only the position of the third line should change

h3. Actual behavior
The position of the second line moves based on the heading type used for the third line.
fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro: Position of Heading 6 Changes Based on Heading Size Following it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34533].
  {panel}

When playing an embedded youtube video, inserted into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector, using Chrome it does not have the fullscreen button. I have tested this in the reported 5.4.3 and verified it still behaves this way in 5.5.4

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Embed a Youtube video into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector
# In Chrome, navigate to the page and play the video
# There will be no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner

h3. Expected behavior
There should be a fullscreen button in the bottom right corner.

h3. Actual behavior
There is no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner of the video.

h3. Related Notes
* The fullscreen button does appear using Safari and Firefox.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to not use the Widget Connector, but embed the YouTube video directly in the page using the (disabled by default) HTML Macro

# Enable the [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html]
# Go to a page you want to have a YouTube video embedded
# Add an empty HTML Macro to the page
# Go to the YouTube video you want to embed
# Click the Share button in the video
# Click the Embed Tab
# Copy the full HTML code provided
# Paste that into the HTML Macro in the Confluence page
# Save the Page
fields.summary: Embedded Youtube Fullscreen Button Missing in Chrome

fields.description:
Confluence is unable to export to word a page that contains a jira issue link that uses a different icon other than the default.

The use case was the following:
1) Setup a Confluence 5.5.3 and JIRA 6.2.7 (5.1.7 also have failed).
2) Installed the Agile plugin on JIRA and created a sample project.
3) Went to JIRA -> administration -> issues and edited the epic issue type.
4) Changed the issue icon:

From this:{color:blue} /images/icons/ico_epic.png {color}

To this: {color:red}/download/resources/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-webactions/images/ico_epic.png {color}

5) Set the Confluence and jira application links
6) Create a Confluence page and insert a jira issue link (+ -> jira issue -> recently viewed -> select an epic issue link)
7) Save the page and try to export to word.

The page won't be displayed and the following appears in Confluence logs:
{code}
 [http-8090-5] [[Standalone].[localhost].[/].[exportword]] log Servlet.service() for servlet exportword threw exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer.createInputStreamFromRelativeUrl(ExportWordPageServer.java:426)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer.extractImagesFromPage(ExportWordPageServer.java:363)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer.outputWordDocument(ExportWordPageServer.java:233)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer.service(ExportWordPageServer.java:172)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.SpringManagedServlet.service(SpringManagedServlet.java:64)
{code}

The page can still be exported to PDF, however if you look the exported file, the icon for the epic link is missing. 

This was noted for pages exported that uses the PlantUML plugin as well.

h3. Workaround
The workaround for pages exports that fails on JIRA issues icons is to change the icon to the other URL path and refresh confluence page to be able to export to word.

Another workaround would be to remove the "Issue Type" from the "Display Options", before adding the issue on the Confluence page, as it would then allow the export.
fields.summary: Unable to export to word when page contains unresolved icon URLs
Ability to disable "Follow User"

fields.description:
As page edit permission is not inherited, changing a parent page edit permission does not affect it's descendants permission. Therefore, there is no need to re-index descendant pages while changing a parent page edit permission. However, there are some redundant calls to re-indexing procedure cause performance downgrade while changing a page edit permission.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a TEST page that has several children pages
* Add edit permission to TEST page
* If you observe the behavior of {{setContentPermissions}} method in {{DefaultContentPermissionManager}} class, you'll find that this function calls {{reindexContent}} which indexes TEST page and it's descendants. Obviously, this is an unexpected behavior.

h3.Number of items added to the index queue entry:
# Monitor the contents of the *INDEXQUEUEENTRIES* table in the Confluence Database
# Remove an edit restriction from a page with *no child pages* (notice that there will be 3 entries added to the index queue)
# Remove an edit restriction from a page with *1 child page* (notice that there will be 6 entries added to the index queue)
# Remove an edit restriction from a page with *2 child pages* (notice that there will be 9 entries added to the index queue)
fields.summary: Redundant calls to re-indexing procedure cause performance downgrade while changing page edit permission
Redundant calls to re-indexing procedure cause performance downgrade while changing page edit permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34510].
  {panel}

I would like a way to view all inline comments at once. This is mostly related to how I like to consume content and is a personal thing, but I think it's worth raising anyway (I doubt I'm alone).

I read a page and then scroll down through the comments. I don't read every one, but rather a few things will prompt me to read a particular comment:
# The name of the commenter - if it's someone with interesting opinions I'm more likely to want to read what they have to say
# The ones with lots of replies
# The ones that start with interesting phrases like 'I disagree', 'let me play devils advocate' etc
# The long comments where people are obviously passionate about the topic
# Ones that have a standout sentence in bold or a headline or something eye catching
# Inline comments that are _unresolved_

With inline comments, I can't immediately see if a little yellow bar has 80 passionate comments underneath it, and unless I click on every highlighted word, I'm likely to miss out on important discussion. I feel like I can scan down a page and get a vibe from the page comments too, which I'm now missing with inline comments.

For me, I feel like it's taken away some of the inclusive and easy nature of collaboration that Confluence is amazing for.

Ideas:
# Have a way as the author to change an inline comment into a page comment, and start it with the highlighted text in a quote. That way if something becomes a vital discussion it can be moved to a place it will be more visible to casual page viewers
# Have a 'view all' button that does the above for all inline comments for the current viewer only
# Have a user setting that does the above for all pages by default (ie disable inline comments per user)
# Display a count of comments in the top right of the highlighted text so it's easy to see where the discussion is
fields.summary: View all inline comments at once

fields.description:
If you have pages that contains Curly Quotes/Smarts Quotes (“”) in it's title  and generate a xml backup you will observe that after importing the xmlbackup the Curly Quotes/Smarts Quotes will be converted to regular quotes.

That will cause any links to these pages to get broken, since the page title changed and hence redirect you to a creating page screen instead of the actual page.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create two spaces called "Dummy Space" and "Testing the Link"
# Under Dummy create a child page:
{code}
“Curly Quotes”
{code}
(i) Copy the above example because if you use regular quotes you will not see this behaviour.
# Now click in Tools > "Link to this Page"
# Copy the Link.
# Go Into the Testing Link space Home page and paste the link you copied.
(i) Everything will work as expected.
# Go to Confluence Admin > Backup and Restore.
# Generate a [Confluence XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Manually+Backing+Up+the+Site]
# Still in the Backup and restore page restore the previously generated xml file.
# Go to The Testing the Link Home page.
# Now if you click in the link to "Curly Quotes" you will be redirected to a creation page instead of the “Curly Quotes” page.
# If you navigate to the page under the dummy space you will notice that it's contentid is the same however the title was converted from:
{code}
“Curly Quotes”
{code}
to
{code}
"Curly Quotes"
{code}
fields.summary: The XML import process convert the title of pages using Curly quotes.

fields.description:
As a Confluence user, I do not want to lose edits made to a page due to license issues.

Currently, the user is not notified of license issues until s\he hits 'save' - there is no way to recover the changes already done in the edit session : the edits are lost (see error message displayed by confluence in attachment).

Either users should be blocked from  editing when license issues are detected, or there should be a way to return to the edit screen (with edits intact) so that the user can either keep the window open until the license issue is resolved or copy/save the changes somewhere else for later recovery.  In other words: either disable the edits or make them recoverable..    It is NOT acceptable to allow edits only to later lose them.
fields.summary: Edits to page lost due to license issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34498].
  {panel}

A customer has experienced using [Confluence manual installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Manually] and using [Confluence installation wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+on+Windows] (.exe). He has praised the installation wizard speeds up the upgrade process tremendously but would like to include a few suggestion and improvements.

*1. Modification logs claimed it is not clear enough*
* From his description, the logs statement is not being very clear. For example, the log says MySQL jdbc driver is not added into the file and requires to be applied manually, but in fact the previous jdbc driver file still exist.
** there should have an additional checking if the jdbc driver already exist in the folder.

*2. Installer should also check for {{conf/}} and {{/bin}} modifications, since we will have several modifications*
* setenv.sh, setenv.bat, server.xml, web.xml and others

*3.The wizard compares and copies modification files to another folder*
* compared file with differences will by copied into a new folder. Example:
** {{changes/conf/server.xml-modifications}}
** {{changes/bin/setenv.sh-modifications}}

*4. The wizard prompts to replace modified files to installation directory*
* After step 3, installer prompts if user wants to copy the modified files into installation directory or not (one by one)
** it's like copying "test.txt" into another folder with "test.txt" file exist in Windows, it will then prompt if you want to replace or not.
!http://i.stack.imgur.com/Iz7Dr.png!

It sounds tedious and I am sure there are several factors we need to take into consideration, but if done correctly, it may save Confluence administrators other amount of time to re-customize Confluence and configuration settings.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence Installation Wizard on Upgrade Logs and Notifications

fields.description:
Page A contains a task for user Z and a hyperlink to Page B. When Page B gets modified by user Y, user Z receives a notification that a new task has been assigned to him by user Y. This is confusing, since user Y did not actually touch page A, nor did he have rights to do so, let alone create a new task.

(I am aware there are a few bugs related to new tasks/notifications being fired when a page is changed, but this gives a new ring to it I believe)
fields.summary: Changing a *hyperlinked* page fires off new task notification

fields.description:
Confluence is not using best practices web performance.

A test with standard  tools demonstrates the problem on your own confluence page, confluence.atlassian.com:
http://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fdisplay%2FDOC%2FConfluence%2BDocumentation%2BHome&tab=desktop
http://gtmetrix.com/reports/confluence.atlassian.com/mUpx4Cgj
http://tools.pingdom.com/fpt/#!/cDSAah/https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home

A typical pageload on confluence.atlassian.com for me takes 2-4 seconds. For a comparable site stackoverflow.com normally loads in 1-2 seconds. See attached screenshots from chrome developer tools. 

We have a 200 seat license but I have problems getting every one to use confluence and I believe some of the problems are related to the fact that the page feels really slow. I believe this is a major problem with confluence and hope you will prioritize fixing it as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Performance problems in confluence
Able to Change the default group For Confluence like Jira

fields.description:
When a page is renamed or deleted, the PageNotFoundAction is called, which in turn calls the PageManager. This class finds pages that are similar to the original page in other spaces, and in doing hits the database hard, specifically the cwd_groups and spaces tables. 

This results in the CPU of the database spiking, making Confluence completely inaccessible.

*Workaround:*

Edit the {{<confluence_install>/confluence/pages/alternativepages.vm}} to exclude the call to the template that renders the list of suggestions. Remove the following from that file:

{code}#parse("/pages/alternativepages-results.vm"){code}
fields.summary: Accessing a renamed or deleted page causes database CPU spikes and Confluence outages

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Press on Bullet list button to create a bullet list
# Type some text
# Press Enter to start a new line of the bullet list
# Insert Expand macro the the second bullet point
# Inside expand macro add number list and puts some text
# Save the page 

h4. Expected result:
The numbered list inside the expand macro is visible in the view mode

h4. Actual result:
Unable to Add Numbered List inside a Expand Macro

h4. Workaround:
Expand macro has to be outside the bullet list to be displayed on the view mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34485].
  {panel}

It will be nice that we can resolve/change Jira's issue status from confluence without login to Jira, So that we can update the documentation and resolve the issue from confluence at the same time 

*The background*
:
Our project managers would like to use the power of Jira issue tracking, but the employees with no technical background don't accept to-do lists more complex than the tasks in Confluence.
For each project the manager sets up a Confluence page with the relevant jira filter widgets for all members and everyone is in the loop. So far so good. But the members don't like to work with Jira, the don't understand it and I must admit that opening the Jira issue to mark if as done interrupts your workflow.

If only the members could check a Jira issue in Confluence with one click, than it would be the perfect project management tool for non-developers.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34483].
  {panel}

In general, when common users open an attachment in a page, it will be either opened or saved. For users that are more advanced and IT-savvy, they may open it in a new tab by holding (Ctrl/Shift/Command) depending on browser. There are also KB and answers giving guide on how to open attachments in new tab automatically.

* [How do I make my attachments open in a new window or a tab?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=191500500]
* [How to make attachments open in new tabs?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/90726/how-to-make-attachments-open-in-new-tabs]

However, based on customer experience, setting the Javascript or HTML tag will result opening new tabs for all pages and link. 

It would be great if Confluence has a configuration to define whether attachments can be open in a new tab or not. (viewing pages and other links will not be affected)
fields.summary: Option to Open Attachments in New Window/Tab

fields.description:
As a project manager I want to be able to report on JIRA issues with a custom layout which lists more information than just the key, summary and status.

This feature is very similar to the table view where additional fields that are displayed in Confluence can be selected. However, I do not want to use a table but a different layout.
For this reason, I have created a user macro in Confluence that takes the JIRA issue key as its input parameter. The user macro then builds a custom table to show the JIRA issue along with more details. Unfortunately, Confluence does not create a link to the JIRA issue in this case although the JIRA macro is used inside the user macro.

With this limitation, we cannot use Confluence and JIRA for requirements tracking as planned because we do not get the automatic update that a JIRA issue (i.e. requirement) has got a reference in the corresponding requirements document in Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence does not create a link to the JIRA issue if the JIRA macro is used in a user macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34473].
{panel}
h3. Also affects the current version of Confluence in all Cloud instances.
h3. Steps to Reproduce in Self Hosted Confluence instances using LDAP:
 # Add an LDAP user as a watcher to a page
 # Remove the user from LDAP
 # Sync the LDAP directory in Confluence
 # View the page's *Manage Watchers*
 # Try to remove the Unknown User
 # Reload the page, and notice that the Unknown User still appears there:
 !watcher.jpg!

h3. Workaround

As a space administrator, remove the invalid user from the watchers list.
h4. +*For a specific user*+
If the user disappears and reappears then do:
# Find the user:
{code:sql}
SELECT username FROM user_mapping WHERE user_key IN (SELECT username FROM notifications WHERE contentid = <PAGEID>);{code}
PAGEID can be determined by going to *Ellipsis button > Page information* and grabbing the last number in the Browser URL.
# Get your user_key by selecting the user from the previous query and searching with:
{code:sql}
SELECT user_key FROM user_mapping WHERE username = '<YOUR_USERNAME_HERE>';{code}
This will also fix the problem for any other pages that have that deleted user as a watcher
# +*Backup Database*+
# Delete all notifications for the invalid user:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM notifications WHERE username = '<YOUR_USER_KEY_HERE>';{code}

h4. +For any invalid/deleted user regardless of the pages they're watching+
# Find the invalid user list (this is to confirm that the listed users are actually invalid, before removing them):
{code:sql}
SELECT n.notificationid AS "Notification ID"
     , s.spacename      AS "Space Name"
     , n.contentid      AS "Page ID"
     , c.title          AS "Page Title"
     , um.username      AS "Invalid User Name"
     , um.user_key      AS "Invalid User Key"
  FROM notifications n
 INNER JOIN user_mapping um ON (n.username = um.user_key)
 INNER JOIN content c ON (n.contentid = c.contentid)
 INNER JOIN spaces s  ON (c.spaceid = s.spaceid)
 WHERE um.lower_username NOT IN ( SELECT lower_user_name 
                                    FROM cwd_user );
{code}
# +*Backup Database*+
# Delete all notifications for the invalid users:
{code:sql}
DELETE 
   FROM notifications 
  WHERE notificationid IN ( SELECT notificationid
                              FROM notifications n
                             INNER JOIN user_mapping um ON (n.username = um.user_key)
                             INNER JOIN content c ON (n.contentid = c.contentid)
                             INNER JOIN spaces s  ON (c.spaceid = s.spaceid)
                             WHERE um.lower_username NOT IN ( SELECT lower_user_name 
                                                                FROM cwd_user ) );
{code}

h4. +Confirm the workaround worked+
# Reload one of the affected pages and check its Watchers
# If the affected page still shows the issue then Flush Cache (*Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Cache Management > Flush all*)
fields.summary: Deleted users still active on watcher's list for Confluence pages - show as an Unknown User and Cannot Be Deleted.

fields.summary: What's New Plugin Duplicates After Upgrading Confluence

fields.description:
[The documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Attaching+Files+to+a+Page] says:

You can also drag and drop files:
* directly onto the 'Attachments' view for the page.
* directly onto the editor view of the page.
* onto any tab of the 'Insert Link' or 'Insert Image' dialogs, which are available from the Insert menu while editing.

The final option does not work.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop on "Insert Link" page doesn't work
Ability to Control Line and Paragraph Spacing in Confluence Page

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34467].
  {panel}

Adding this macro to a page with many users (~200) increases load times by a factor of 10. From 3 seconds to about 30 seconds.

Ideas:
* Caching
* (Optional) Asynchronous loading of the list

Some additional notes:

* "Preview" has normal performance, just the published page is slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34462].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate:*

# Start Confluence without developer mode
# Using Firefox 30.0 or 32.0 to create a new page in Confluence.
# Insert a table into that page
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Click 'Insert' drop down in editor menu bar.
# Scroll down the options

*Result:*

The first two options (image and link) can be highlighted and selected, but the rest of the options in the drop down do not highlight and cannot be selected.

*Workaround:*

Within the editor, where you want to insert a macro enter an open curly brace '{' this will bring up the insert dialog and allow you to insert a macro.
fields.summary: Unable to insert a macro into a table using Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34457].
  {panel}
Currently, only space templates can be promoted as per mentioned in the following documentation: [Page Templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-templates-296093785.html#PageTemplates-PromotetemplatesintheCreatedialog]

It'll be great if we can promote Global Templates on space by space basis

Once you promote any blueprint, all global templates get hidden in "show more" area - with no ability to promote. Please allow a global template to be promoted per space.

Workaround:
At the moment I have to create a template for each space (copy of the global template) and then promote it inside the space. This creates unnecessary duplicates.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to promote global templates on a per-space basis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34456].
  {panel}

Since I updated Firefox to version 31.0 I am unable to change the cell color of tables on existing pages. This still works fine when I test with Internet Explorer 10. It also works fine when creating new pages.

_Steps to reproduce:_
# Open an existing page that contains a table
# Select the cell of which you want to change the color
# Click on the "Change cell color" drop-down
# Try to select color

_Actual result:_
The mouse cursor changes immediately from the "hand" to the regular mouse pointer after which it is not possible to select the desired color. In other words: nothing happens.

_Expected result:_
As with other drop-downs in the editing menu bar, I would expect the cursor to be the "hand" type and be able to click on the desired color after which the cell color should change.

_Additional info:_
I noticed that this also applies to the drop-down for the text color, where only the colors that are shown below the editing menu bar (i.e. over the edited pages) are inaccessible.
fields.summary: Cannot change cell color for existing tables in Firefox

fields.description:
In Confluence, to get help for the search, we have the question mark option in the search field (?): 

!search.png!

And as we know, it will include the following information:

{quote}
Exact phrase search
To search for content that contains the exact phrase "chalk and cheese":
"chalk and cheese"

OR search
To search for content that contains one of the terms, "chalk" OR "cheese":
"chalk OR cheese"

AND search
To search for content that contains both the terms "chalk" AND "cheese":
"chalk AND cheese"
{quote}

However, it seems to be incorrect:

"chalk and cheese" (with quotes round) does not find the specified phrase.

To do it, we would need to:

*"chalk" OR "cheese"* and for the other one, it would be *"chalk" AND "cheese"

Assuming that, it must be specified without the quotes to do what is described.
fields.summary: Incorrect Help for Search Syntax

fields.description:
h2.Summary
When embedding a Microsoft Word (docx) document for the first time, it will render correctly.  After editing the document in any way, and re-embedding the document, the font for random sections (may or may not be the entire all of the text) will appear blue and underlines when moused-over.  Also, if the document is edited before it is embedded, it renders correctly.  Only after the document has been embedded, removed, edited and re-embedded will this issue occur.

h2.Steps to reproduce
   * Create a word document with text
   * go to a confluence page and edit the page
   * drag the word document onto the page and ‘Save'
   * Edit the page again and remove the document and ‘Save'
   * Edit the word document (i have merely added a line at the top of the document and then deleted it) and then save
   * Edit the page and drag the word document onto the page and ‘Save’
   * The document will now render with a blue font and will underline in certain sections when moused-over

h2. Expected Behavior
The document should render exactly as the word document looks no matter what changes have been made.

h2. Actual Behavior
The document displays blue font for seeming random portions of the text and underlines text when moused-over

I have not found any other JAC articles relating.  I have not found a workaround, the text is still there, it is just the formatting that appears to be affected.  I have noted the environment info in the appropriate space on this bug report, but I will include here just in case.

-Confluence standalone
-Mac (Firefox) and (Chrome): Customer Windows 7 (Firefox) and (Chrome)
-JDK 1.7.0_60
-Using Confluence Version 5.2.3:  Customer Version 5.2
fields.summary: Embedded Word Documents on a Confluence Page Change Font Color and Underline When Moused Over

fields.description:
A sample of code macro is created in Google Chrome. (see img1.PNG)

When edit and adding newlines at the end of the row (point your word cursor to the end of the row, then press enter), the first newline entered is not added, the second newline entered works. Scenario affects Google Chrome, IE11, IE10, IE9.

For Firefox 31, the first newline entered becomes a space instead in edit(see image firefox2.PNG)

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Create a simple code macro in a new page with LINE1, LINE2, and save.
{code}
LINE1
LINE2
{code}
2. Edit the page. Add a new line between LINE1 and LINE2 and save.
{code}
LINE1

LINE2
{code}

*Expected:* newlines are added between line codes

*Result:* 1st newline is not added

However, if you insert a newline between LINE1 and LINE2 with contents, the newline exist and will be saved. Inserting newline between the line of words works as expected.
fields.summary: Inserting First Empty Newline at End of Row when Editing Code Macro is Not Added

like PDF, docx etc.
latest version of attachment ist shown in embedding

Until now this is not possible with attached plain text files

More: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/320050/embedding-mime-type-text-in-confluence?page=1#321176

This is not about embedding Office Files, Images, Multi Media or PDF which are supported.



It should not be neccessary to edit page each time an attachment has changed / was updated by dropping it in page window.
Embedding should show the content of the actual version of the attached / embedded file with mime type text.
fields.summary: embedding of attachments with mime type text
